intro: Ecbolium spicatum, commonly known as the spiked ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in spikes, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Ecbolium spicatum is often found in grassland habitats and is adapted to dry, temperate climates.
